[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [All check() implementations] [Exception Handling] Are all possible errors from external dependencies properly caught and converted to Result types, or can uncaught exceptions crash the health checker? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [All URL-based variants] [IPv6 Handling] Do URL-based health checks properly handle IPv6 addresses, or can IPv6-specific vulnerabilities like address parsing errors or bypass attacks occur? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [All URL-based variants] [Proxy Configuration] Can an attacker exploit proxy settings in reqwest or other HTTP clients to redirect health checks through malicious proxies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [All async functions] [Runtime Starvation] Can blocking operations in check() implementations starve the async runtime, preventing other critical tasks from executing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [All async functions] [Context Cancellation] Are async operations properly cancelled when parent futures are dropped, or can orphaned tasks continue consuming resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Module dependencies] [Dependency Confusion] Can an attacker exploit vulnerabilities in dependencies like reqwest, diesel_async, or tonic to compromise health checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: check() - Http variant] [HTTP Request Smuggling] Can an attacker craft URLs that exploit HTTP request smuggling vulnerabilities in reqwest's request building, allowing requests to unintended endpoints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: check() - NodeApi variant] [Chain ID Manipulation] Does get_index() validate the chain ID returned by the Node API, or can an attacker provide a node API that returns data from a different blockchain, causing cross-chain attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: check() - DataServiceGrpc variant] [Protobuf Bomb] Can a malicious GRPC server send deeply nested or recursive protobuf messages that cause stack overflow or excessive CPU usage during deserialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: check() - Postgres variant] [Transaction Rollback] If the database connection is used within a transaction context elsewhere, does the health check interfere with transaction isolation or cause unexpected rollbacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: check() - Processor variant] [Concurrent Update Race] Can concurrent updates to processor_status table cause the health check to see inconsistent states, such as processor name existing but version being temporarily set to 0? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: wait_for_startup()] [Exponential Backoff Missing] Does the linear retry interval at line 204 cause unnecessary load on services during startup, potentially delaying recovery or causing cascading failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [All variants] [Health Check Recursion] Can health checks trigger recursive or circular dependencies where checking service A requires checking service B which requires checking service A, causing deadlocks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [All variants] [Bootstrap Vulnerability] During initial localnet bootstrap, can an attacker race against health checks to inject malicious services that pass checks but compromise the system? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: check() - Http variant] [Cookie Handling] Does reqwest automatically handle cookies, and if so, can an attacker exploit cookie-based session fixation or CSRF vulnerabilities through health check requests? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: check() - Http variant] [User-Agent Spoofing] Can the health check be fingerprinted by its User-Agent header, allowing attackers to specifically target or block health check requests? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: check() - NodeApi variant] [Ledger Version Mismatch] Does get_index() validate ledger versions and chain state, or can an attacker provide a node API with forked or outdated blockchain data that passes health checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: check() - DataServiceGrpc variant] [Stream Backpressure] Can a slow consumer of the GRPC stream cause backpressure that affects the health check, potentially causing false negatives during high load? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: check() - Postgres variant] [Connection Pool Poisoning] Can repeated failed connections poison the PostgreSQL connection pool, affecting other legitimate database operations beyond health checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: check() - Processor variant] [Schema Evolution] If the processor_status table schema evolves (e.g., adding new columns), does the query at line 91 break due to tuple size mismatches? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: check() - IndexerApiMetadata variant] [Metadata Injection] Can an attacker inject malicious Hasura metadata that appears valid but contains backdoors, such as unauthorized roles or exposed admin endpoints? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: wait()] [String Allocation] Can the format!() calls at lines 135-142 cause excessive string allocations during rapid health check failures, leading to memory pressure? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: address_str()] [Path Traversal] If URLs contain path components, does address_str() properly sanitize these to prevent path traversal attacks in log files or monitoring systems? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [Function: wait_for_startup()] [Instant Overflow] At line 190, can Instant::now() overflow on systems with unusual clock configurations, causing incorrect timeout calculations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-localnet/src/health_checker.rs] [All async functions] [Tokio Runtime Assumptions] Do all async operations assume a multi-threaded tokio runtime, or can they cause issues in single-threaded runtime configurations? (Low)
